skill.name: neurokit2
skill.description: Comprehensive biosignal processing toolkit for analyzing physiological data including ECG, EEG, EDA, RSP, PPG, EMG, and EOG signals. Use this skill when processing cardiovascular signals, brain activity, electrodermal responses, respiratory patterns, muscle activity, or eye movements. Applicable for heart rate variability analysis, event-related potentials, complexity measures, autonomic nervous system assessment, psychophysiology research, and multi-modal physiological signal integration.
skill.summary: Comprehensive biosignal processing toolkit for analyzing physiological data including ECG, EEG, EDA,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were detected in the skill files. Content is documentation and usage guidance for NeuroKit2 only.

content.value_statement: You need reliable physiological signal processing across modalities. This skill guides NeuroKit2 workflows for clean, consistent analysis.
actual_capabilities: Run ECG and PPG processing pipelines with peak detection and quality checks
Compute HRV metrics across time, frequency, and nonlinear domains
Analyze EEG band power and microstates
Process EDA signals with tonic and phasic decomposition
Process respiration signals and compute RRV and RVT
Process multiple signals together with bio_process and bio_analyze
limitations: Requires NeuroKit2 installed in the runtime environment
Does not collect data from sensors or devices
Quality depends on sampling rate and signal cleanliness
Not a diagnostic or clinical decision tool

use_cases.title: Multi-signal study prep
use_cases.description: Process ECG, EDA, and respiration data with consistent preprocessing and feature extraction.

use_cases.title: EEG feature extraction
use_cases.description: Compute band power and microstate summaries for EEG experiments.

use_cases.title: HRV reporting
use_cases.description: Generate HRV time and frequency metrics from ECG or PPG peaks.

prompt_templates.title: Quick ECG pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Process this ECG signal at 1000 Hz and summarize R peaks, heart rate, and quality metrics.

prompt_templates.title: HRV metrics report
prompt_templates.prompt: Compute HRV time, frequency, and nonlinear indices from these ECG R peaks at 500 Hz.

prompt_templates.title: EDA decomposition
prompt_templates.prompt: Clean this EDA signal at 100 Hz, split tonic and phasic components, and summarize SCR counts.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-modal study
prompt_templates.prompt: Use bio_process for ECG, RSP, and EDA at 1000 Hz, then summarize key metrics for each modality.

output_examples.input: Analyze this ECG signal for HRV and report the main metrics.
output: R peak detection completed with quality rating
Time domain HRV: SDNN, RMSSD, pNN50
Frequency domain HRV: LF, HF, and LF/HF ratio
Nonlinear HRV: SD1 and SD2 from Poincare plot

best_practices: Provide correct sampling rate for each signal
Use event-related analysis for short epochs
anti_patterns: Mix signals with mismatched sampling rates without resampling

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides prompts and workflows that work in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What data limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Performance depends on signal length and sampling rate. Very short or noisy signals may yield unstable metrics.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It maps to NeuroKit2 functions you can call inside existing Python analysis scripts.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is offline documentation with no data access or network calls.

faq.question: What should I do if results look wrong?
faq.answer: Check sampling rate, clean the signal, and inspect peak detection output before analysis.

faq.question: How does it compare to general signal tools?
faq.answer: It is specialized for physiological signals with validated domain metrics and workflows.
